item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Generate impressive-looking terminal output, look busy when stakeholders walk by (337 points | 96 comments)
2. Show HN: My high school team's space probe (38 points | 2 comments)
3. Lynx is the oldest web browser still being maintained (43 points | 12 comments)
4. Show HN: Nash, I made a standalone note with single HTML file (369 points | 89 comments)
5. Apple's long-lost hidden recovery partition from 1994 has been found (157 points | 37 comments)
6. Implications of Global Privacy Control (9 points | 1 comment)
7. Sign in as anyone: Bypassing SAML SSO authentication with parser differentials (247 points | 88 comments)
8. Command A: Max performance, minimal compute – 256k context window (15 points | 3 comments)
9. Milk Kanban (371 points | 148 comments)
10. Wyvern's Open Satellite Feed (166 points | 5 comments)
11. Implementing "Tennis for Two" using op amps (2024) (18 points | 2 comments)
12. GPT 4.5 level for 1% of the price (19 points | 2 comments)
13. Show HN: A personal YouTube frontend based on yt-dlp (255 points | 163 comments)
14. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (79 points | 53 comments)
15. Career Advice in 2025 (186 points | 98 comments)
16. How many artists' careers did the Beatles kill? (171 points | 157 comments)
17. Finding Signal in the Noise: Machine Learning and the Markets (Jane Street) (138 points | 105 comments)
18. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (105 points | 55 comments)
19. Strengthening AI Agent Hijacking Evaluations (34 points | 9 comments)
20. High-performance computing, with much less code (6 points | discuss)
21. Evidence that Neanderthal and Homo sapiens engaged in cultural exchange (91 points | 57 comments)
22. More pro for the DEC Professional 380 (featuring PRO/VENIX) (23 points | 4 comments)
23. They're Close to My Body: A Hagiography of Nine Inch Nails and Robin Finck (2020) (115 points | 55 comments)
24. Sunsethue – Forecast Sunset Beauty (22 points | 3 comments)
25. Mandelbrot Set Explorer (64 points | 22 comments)
26. Sunset Geometry (2016) (93 points | 12 comments)
27. ASK HN: How to engineer a JavaScript to Python migration? (3 points | 13 comments)
28. What Bikini Atoll Looks Like Today (2017) (164 points | 81 comments)
29. Show HN: Aiopandas – Async .apply() and .map() for Pandas, Faster API/LLMs Calls (50 points | 12 comments)
30. AutoHete: An Automatic and Efficient Heterogeneous Training System for LLMs (40 points | discuss)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 11:15 AM UTC
